intro: Euodia chapelieri var. sessilis, commonly known as the sessile-flowered euodia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rutaceae. It is native to parts of Southeast Asia, including Indonesia and the Philippines. The plant is characterized by its small, fragrant white flowers and oval-shaped, leathery leaves. It typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. The fruit is a small, woody drupe that contains a single seed.
